newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Result of ANI meeting to be known Monday.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Result of ANI meeting to be known Monday.

text.p: Australian National Industries Ltd said it should know some time later on Monday the result of an election calling for the removal of two directors.
The chairman of the heavy engineering firm, Ted Harris, told reporters after the annual meeting the result of the election should bring stability to the company's board of directors.
Harris said he could not comment on whether managing director Peter Stancliffe would remain with the company if rebel director Ross Palmer was re-elected to the board.
Palmer has the largest personal shareholding in ANI with a stake of five percent.
His re-election has been opposed by fellow director Peter Joseph, who in turn is being opposed by Palmer.

Palmer has become a minority voice on the board since his decision last month to publicly reveal that he was in charge of an investigation over the purchase of a business by ANI's German subsidiary, Holter, of another environmental engineering business, ABT.

Harris and Stancliffe have supported the re-election of Joseph, who has the supported of most institutional investors in ANI. The re-election votes require a majority of 50.1 percent, with institutions holding more than 68 percent of the company.
